fields.value: Annual Survey of Jails in Indian Country, 2001:  [United States]

authorName.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: The objective of the Survey of Jails in Indian Country is  to gather data on all adult and juvenile jail facilities and detention  centers in Indian country, which is defined for purposes of this  collection as reservations, pueblos, rancherias, and other Native  American and Alaska Native communities throughout the United  States. The survey, a complete enumeration of all 68 confinement  facilities operated by tribal authorities or the Bureau of Indian  Affairs (BIA), provides data on number of inmates and facility  characteristics and needs. Variables describe each facility, including  rated capacity, number of adult inmates, number of juveniles held,  number of inmates held by sex and conviction status on June 29, number  of admissions and discharges in the last 30 days, number of inmate  deaths, the peak population during June, facility crowding, and renovation and building plans.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System
